What is PSR in PHP?

Aug 10, 2019

What is PSR in PHP?

PSR in PHP stands for PHP Standard Recommendation and its purpose is to help standardize some programming concepts in PHP.

Those recommendations are proposed and approved by the PHP Framework Interop Group, a group of several framework developers and founders whose aim is to talk about the commonalities of their projects and propose a common basis to work together. The full list of PSRs can be found here.

Although itâ€™s not mandatory to follow those rules, ideally, following a set of standards allow other developers to easily understand and work with your code and also makes it easier to integrate with third-party components (and vice-versa).

This can be achieved by following one or more PSRs or other coding standards like PEAR coding standards for instance.

More resources on PHP Code style can be found here.

Resources

  • https://www.php-fig.org
  • https://phptherightway.com
